Plot and analyse genes per cell distribution

Source: R/qc_utils.R
plot_genes_per_cell_distribution.Rd

Creates a detailed visualisation of genes per cell distribution and calculates suggested quality control parameters. Optimised for both dense and sparse matrices to accommodate large-scale single-cell datasets.

Usage

plot_genes_per_cell_distribution(
  gene_counts,
  plot_type = "hist",
  percentile_cutoffs = c(0.05, 0.95),
  return_suggestions = TRUE
)

Arguments

gene_counts

A matrix of gene counts (rows = genes, columns = cells). Supports both standard and sparse matrices from the Matrix package.

plot_type

Character, one of "hist" (histogram) or "density" (density plot)

percentile_cutoffs

Numeric vector of percentiles to show as cutoff lines

return_suggestions

Logical, whether to return suggested QC parameters

Value

If return_suggestions=TRUE, returns a list containing:

  • min_genes_per_cell: Suggested minimum genes per cell

  • max_genes_per_cell: Suggested maximum genes per cell

  • median_genes: Median number of genes per cell

  • summary_stats: Additional statistics
